review.title: Everything was excellent. Awesome friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Everything was amazing about the hotel... big, clean, fun room. Friendly staff, a few with awesome sense of humour. Really nice hotel. If there was one criticism to be found is that the bathroom remodel budget could have been larger, but the throw back feature added some charm.

review.title: Beautiful historic hotel in exactly the right area
review.reviewText: Beautifully designed hotel, with very attentive and professional staff.

review.title: Great hotel near theaters, shoping and fine dining
review.reviewText: I have been a long time fan of the Clift it is great value for your travel dollar!

review.title: stylish, great location and value
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed my stay at the Clift. Quick check in, my room had a great view of the city, was clean with a comfortable bed. The Redwood Room bar is one of the nicest in the city.

we started in rm 219 ---noisy till 2am , tiny and stuffy--We complained in the morning. For the next six days we were upgraded to rm. 1203 which was at least 2x the size, cleaner, much nicer, and more than adequate. We were extremely happy with the way the staff took care of our problems. This was our second stay at the Clift and it won`t be our last.

managementResponses.response:
Hi Robert,

Thank you for leaving us feedback regarding your recent stay.  I am glad to hear you enjoyed your stay and our team, though sorry the price point was a little off of what you were looking for.

review.title: Nice hotel, centrally located but too expensive!!
review.reviewText: Very clean, excellent staff!, had to ask for top sheets on bed otherwise just an all too warm comforter. Great lounge and bar!

managementResponses.response: Per the survey which you submitted, I understand that your visit did not meet your expectations. Our goal is to ensure that all of our guests receive the experience which not only meets, but exceeds their expectations. We are disappointed to learn that was not the case on this particular stay.

review.title: Awful
review.reviewText: My credit card wouldn't swipe and they did not enter manually. AC did not work the first 3 nights.

review.title: generally good
review.reviewText: Stayed for over a week. Great front of house and restaurant/bar staff, but they spent a lot of time daily apologizing for the management decision of not having any ice available without going thru room service. Room service always took multiple calls, from us and the desk staff, to actually bring ice, and even then sometimes we gave up after an hour or so. Also, ice arrives in an open container so that it melts right away. The mini bar is very packed (could be a good thing if you want to buy a lot from there) but leaves no room for any personal use (as diabetics we needed a place to keep insulin which required about 4 cubic inches of space and that meant putting the insulin in odd positions on top of drinks---yes, it was THAT crowded...); forget about using it for your own drinks or food.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the Green program which gave us a $15 coupon for use in the restaurant in exchange for maid service only every fourth day. Location is great.
review.negativeRemarks: Add an ice machine! If there is a real concern for going green, replace the trendy faucets which fail to turn off in rooms and in the downstairs loo.
review.locationRemarks: In the Tenderloin district, so there are lots of homeless begging just beyond the entrances. Staff told us it wasn't safe to exit and turn left.

review.title: Nice hotel good location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is really nice good location. The room was comfortable 
The only negative point was the gym was too small
Nice hotel.  Great location and friendly staff.  However, the rooms were outdated and not in the best condition.  Needs some remodeling and updating.
review.negativeRemarks: Condition of the rooms, especially for the price paid.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to leave us this positive feedback regarding your recent stay at with us at the Clift.  We are glad it was such a positive experience, though sorry the food did not pass the mark.

review.title: Stylish, comfortable hotel in city center
review.reviewText:
The staff were friendly, the hotel very clean and while the room was small, it was so well designed that the size wasn't an issue. The water pressure in the shower was amazing! Best shower experience possibly ever. 
The bed was super comfortable and the AC kept the room nice and cool. The hotel has a bar with "living portraits" (think Harry Potter). The bar is quite elegant and a place even locals recommend. The food, however, was mediocre so just stay for a drink. There's plenty of great restaurants nearby anyway. 
The bathroom did lack ventilation. I forgot to mention that. But the room was soundproof and so cozy! We would definitely stay here again. Great value.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us your positive feedback Jill, we are glad to hear you had such an enjoyable experience with us.

review.title: Treated myself to whimsical,  modern hotel
review.reviewText: Romantic room with floor to ceiling curtains that can enclose the bed area or open revealing floor to ceiling mirrors.   Just beautiful.  Very polite staff that also  knows to let you be.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to leave us your feedback Kob, we are glad to hear you enjoyed some aspects of the experience though sorry the service fell short during your stay.

review.title: Location! Location!
review.reviewText: Great location, in the heart of everything. I did not interact with the staff much other than checking in and out. However, during my short interaction with the staff for the 5 days I stayed, nobody offered any information about other service(s) they had. Breakfast is not included and there was no complimentary coffee for the price tag.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for your feedback.  We are sorry to hear this past experience with us was not on the level you have come to expect.  Rest assured this is not a new standard on any level.

review.title: ..off the Clift!
review.reviewText: Too much of a party/street life experience making its way into the hotel for me.  I have stay here before and enjoyed it.  Maybe there was a convention in town.. not enjoyable and the staff must have felt the stress cause they were not ON it!

managementResponses.response: I wanted to reach out to you regarding your recent stay at Clift. Per the survey which you submitted, I understand that your visit did not meet your expectations. Our goal is to ensure that all of our guests receive the experience which not only meets, but exceeds their expectations. I am disappointed to learn that was not the case on this particular stay, especially with regards to the noise issue coming from next door.

review.title: noisy, noisy, not classy!
review.reviewText:
I complained about guests next door fighting til 3 am. Walks are thin .  Did not get enough sleep.  

Awful customer service even after my complaint. They just go thru the motion of sending you a generic apology letter!  Just refund my money please for my horrible night!

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay with us here at Clift.  I am glad to hear our team was able to help celebrate for such a special occasion, though sorry there was that little snafu along the way.

review.title: Classic Hotel, small snafu
review.reviewText: What a great hotel with lovely staff, Angelica at the front desk and Erica at the concierge were wonderful. Angelica helped me set something up for my girlfriends birthday (bottle of champagne to the room), unfortunately the bottle came two hours late after repeated calls due to the other staff. Can't complain too much at all about that though because they did me a solid. The hotel itself was beautiful, they were very accommodating and its in a great location. I would definitely stay again

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your positive feedback regarding this past stay.  We are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay.

review.title: Very good location
review.reviewText: Room was on 14 floor and the view was very nice. Room was spacious and bed was very comfortable. The location of hotel is very good if you use the public transport. There are a lot of shops near on Market street. If you don't eat a breakfast in hotel there is a Starbucks on the other site of the street.

managementResponses.response:
Hi Chris, 
Thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback regarding your recent stay with us here at Clift, we are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay.

review.title: Stylish Hotel Experience Near Union Square
review.reviewText: Clift is a stylish, contemporary, hotel in a great location. Comparable to the Bryant Park Hotel in Manhattan. Well trained and capable staff. Medium-large, clean guest rooms. Well-performing, free in-room WiFi or direct Ethernet connection. Free premium coffee in the lobby each morning until 10. Lovely breakfast buffet, a tad overpriced. Pleasing menu and cuisine available in the lobby restaurant or for in-room dining. The elegant-yet-hip Redwood Room, featuring outstanding cocktails and service, vibes with youthful, adult energy--especially on Friday and Saturday evenings. Bypass the hotel valet and park at one of the two garages that are just steps away on Taylor Street between Geary and O'Farrell. Both garages offer in-out privileges and valet service 24/7.
review.locationRemarks: Surrounded by upscale dining, shopping, theater, and much more, in the vibrant Union Square area.

managementResponses.response: We are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay to such a degree Z. A., thank you for your feedback.

review.title: Awesome service
review.reviewText: Had the best check in experience! The staff was wonderful,  even have us drink tickets while waited!! Upgraded us without even asking!

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback regarding your recent stay with us at Clift.  I have shared your concerns with the appropriate departments as this is far from the norm for us.

review.title: Great Location, Great Staff but it ends there...
review.reviewText: The Clift truly has a great location and exceptional hotel staff. The hotel lobby does retain a lot of its old world charm and represents today's boutique hotel environment. However, that's where all the good stuff ends. When we first walked into our room, we were greeted by a strange smoky and old musty odor. It inhabited the small hallway between the front door and main living space. We immediately called the front desk and told them. As there were no other rooms available at the time, they offered to clean the carpet as we decided to go out for a stroll around Union Square. When we returned, the smell was replaced by something more pleasant but the odor returned after a few hours. We decided to just avoid that space since we only needed to pass it when entering or exiting the room. A lot of the room fixtures are in disrepair and the bathroom was oddly shaky as well. Cleanliness was not a strongpoint as dirt was visibly accumulated on the door hinges and when I went to rest for the evening and looked at the ceiling, there was a huge clump of dust around one of the ceiling fixture covers. I just prayed that it would not fall on my while I slept.
